definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: He was momentarily blinded by the reflection of the sun off his watch.
sentences.chinese: 手表反射的太阳光让他有一霎那的失明。

sentences.english: The twinkling of an eye go in winter, the spring.
sentences.chinese: 一霎时进去，冬天来了，春天的到来。

sentences.english: With brief eye contact and slight smile, I felt incomparably happy right at that moment.
sentences.chinese: 简短的对视和轻轻微笑，一霎那，我幸福无比。

sentences.english: Please wait a moment, Jane is on another line.
sentences.chinese: 请等那一霎那，简正在接另一条电话线。

sentences.english: The journalist is concerned only with the fugitive moment.
sentences.chinese: 这位新闻工作者所关心的只是一霎那的时刻。

sentences.english: Just to enjoy the moment free at last?
sentences.chinese: 只是为啦享用最终摆脱地那一霎时吗？

sentences.english: Msimilarg full of time in class mea strongs we ca strong spend less time after class.
sentences.chinese: 充真操做上课一霎间意味着课中少花时分。

sentences.english: In an instant, America was transformed from a nation at peace to a country at war.
sentences.chinese: 一霎间，美国从和平安宁转入战争状态。

sentences.english: This is the moment an osprey swooped down and snatched a trout straight out of the water.
sentences.chinese: 这是鱼鹰冲下来抓住鲑鱼出水的一霎。

sentences.english: That splendid smiling expression, fixes a lattice forever in that a moment.
sentences.chinese: 那绚烂地笑脸，永远定格在那一霎时。

sentences.english: And for the briefest of moments, every last man in Shawshank felt free.
sentences.chinese: 就在那一霎那，肖申克监狱的每个人都感到了自由。

definition: one instant/very short time/the twinkle of an eye
an instant (Sanskrit: ksana)/split second/the twinkling of an eye
an instant (Sanskrit: ksana)/split second/the twinkling of an eye
in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
in the wink of an eye/in a flash
